title: Web-Based Mathematical Learning Object Development: IMS Learning Design and Ontology-Driven Adaptive Problem-Solving System

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in the relevant field or equivalent experience, understanding of basic mathematical formulas and proof methods
context.additional_context: Students interact with learning objects using personal devices, and project-based assessments measure learning outcomes, with a focus on evaluating probability calculation and graph interpretation skills.

learning_goals: Design and develop web-based mathematical learning objects with formula calculation and graph visualization functions using IMS LD specifications.
Construct Units of Learning (UOLs) considering interoperability and reusability between learning objects and integrate equation-solving and statistical analysis modules.

Learners design customized math learning scenarios linked to ontology-based software agents (e.g., Protégé, Apache Jena), support three or more learning types (concept explanation, problem-solving, error analysis), and implement a system achieving over 80% user satisfaction in testing.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
